docs.lead_paragraph: ROSSEAU says: " There are but two things that are positive goods--health of body and health of mind; and but two things that are positive evils--pain of body and pain of mind."
docs.snippet: ROSSEAU says: " There are but two things that are positive goods--health of body and health of mind; and but two things that are positive evils--pain of body and pain of mind."

headline.main: The Mechanics' Institute--Letter from Gen. Wool.

docs.lead_paragraph: MY DEAR SIR: A few days since I received your invitation in behalf of the members of the Mechanics' Institute, of the City of New-York, to deliver an address before them at such time during the ensuing season as might be most convenient to myself.
docs.snippet: MY DEAR SIR: A few days since I received your invitation in behalf of the members of the Mechanics' Institute, of the City of New-York, to deliver an address before them at such time during the ensuing season as might be most convenient to myself.

docs.lead_paragraph: A BOY KILLED BY TWO OF HIS COMPANIONS ON RANDALL'S ISLAND.--Yesterday morning Coroner GAMBLE held an inqueet on Randall's Island on the body of JOHN McCAFFRAY, a boy about six years of age. From the testimony of the nurses and two or three boys, we extract the following facts: Mrs. JANE LEY, the matron, testified that the boys (and amongst them the deceased) went to bed at 7 o'clock in the evening all well.

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Cabinet Difficulties--Purchase of the Republic--Departure of Mr. King.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is nothing more certain than that the difficulties in arranging a Cabinet for Mr. PIERCE are increasing to an alarming degree; and nothing is less certain than the precise causes of the difficulty.
docs.snippet: There is nothing more certain than that the difficulties in arranging a Cabinet for Mr. PIERCE are increasing to an alarming degree; and nothing is less certain than the precise causes of the difficulty.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Broadway Railroad. SUPERIOR COURT--General Term.--The BROADWAY RAILROAD--Present Chief Justice OAKLY, Judges DUER, CAMPBELL, PAYNE, BOSWORTH, and EMMET.--Thomas E. Davis and C. Palmer vs. The Mayor and Commonalty.--This case came up before a crowded Court room and a strong array of Counsel.

headline.main: XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: MR. UPHAM'S DEATH--EULOGISTIC SPEECHES, ETC Mr. FOOT, of Vt., said: Mr. President--I rise to perform a melancholy duty this morning, in formally announcing to the Senate, the sad intelligence of the decease of one of the oldest members of this body.
docs.snippet: MR. UPHAM'S DEATH--EULOGISTIC SPEECHES, ETC Mr. FOOT, of Vt., said: Mr. President--I rise to perform a melancholy duty this morning, in formally announcing to the Senate, the sad intelligence of the decease of one of the oldest members of this body.

headline.main: NEW-MEXICO.; Interesting Intelligence--Gov. Lane and the Indians--The Massacre of White's Party in 1849.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mail from New-Nexico arrived yesterday, bringing us papers of the 27th November. At that date, news had just been received of the election of General PIERCE to the Presidency, so that by the aid of a dispatch sent to Independence, and the mail, they were only twenty-five days in ascertaining this important result of the election.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE WEATHER.--The sudden and extreme changes of temperature experienced within the week have scarcely a parallel in this avowedly variable climate. The mercury, which on Monday stood at 44[degrees],was yesterday afternoon down to 10[degrees].
docs.snippet: THE WEATHER.--The sudden and extreme changes of temperature experienced within the week have scarcely a parallel in this avowedly variable climate. The mercury, which on Monday stood at 44[degrees],was yesterday afternoon down to 10[degrees].

headline.main: Interesting Trial Case--Trial of Mr. Bower, at Paris. for the Homicide of Mr. Morton.

docs.lead_paragraph: This affair, which has excited so much interest from the peculiar circumstances connected with the various persons concerned in it, came on yesterday before the Court of Assizes of the Seine, M. Bresson being the presiding Judge.
docs.snippet: This affair, which has excited so much interest from the peculiar circumstances connected with the various persons concerned in it, came on yesterday before the Court of Assizes of the Seine, M. Bresson being the presiding Judge.
